trans-unit.source: CAS Host: Fully qualified host name of your CAS server.
CAS Context: Context of the CAS server (e.g., "/cas").
CAS Port: Port of your CAS server. It is most probably 443 for a HTTPS server.
Frontend Redirect URI: Optional redirect URI after disconnecting from CAS.
Backend Redirect URI: Optional redirect URI after disconnecting from CAS.

CA Certificate Path: Path to the PEM-encoded CA chain that issued the CAS server certificate. Both site-relative and absolute paths supported. CAUTION: VALIDATING THE CAS SERVER IS CRUCIAL TO THE SECURITY OF THE CAS PROTOCOL, SO PLEASE DO NOT LEAVE THIS SETTING EMPTY UNLESS YOU ARE ONLY QUICK TESTING!
Frontend SSO: Tick if SSO should be enabled for Frontend authentication.
Backend SSO: Tick if SSO should be enabled for Backend authentication.

Fix X_FORWARDED_PORT: Under some circumstances, the header "X_FORWARDED_PORT" may be missing but instead the original port is appended to X_FORWARDED_HOST. Although this is valid according to rfc7239#5.3 and rfc7230#2.7.1, you may tick this checkbox to remove it from X_FORWARDED_HOST and set it to X_FORWARDED_PORT.
